title: Painting, 1879
medium: Brush and oil paint on canvas
signed: Signed and dated in brush and oil,  lower right: HOMER 1879.
inscribed: Inscribed in on stretcher, in graphite: "Pri [vate   Win]slow Homer / 51 West 10th St. / City
provenance: Gift of Mrs. Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
creditline: Gift of Mrs. Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
description: Horizontal view of a woman in a dark dress, standing at center under a gloriously blooming apple tree and lowering a branch to possibly break off or to smell in the foreground, as a grassy meadow slopes upward to a further blossoming tree, with rail fence, bushes and buildings in background.

exhibitions.title: Frederic Church, Winslow Homer & Thomas Moran: Tourism and the American Landscape

tombstone.epitaph:
Painting, 1879.
1879. Brush and oil paint on canvas. Gift of Mrs. Charles Savage Homer, Jr.. 1918-20-7.
